thread.title: Latest twist in negotiations a bad omen for Horn
thread.title_full: Latest twist in negotiations a bad omen for Horn

title: Latest twist in negotiations a bad omen for Horn
text:
Manny to fight Khan not Horn 0:45 Manny Pacquiao’s adviser can’t rule out a fight between his client and Amir Khan instead of Jeff Horn February 21, 2017 7:27pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS MANNY Pacquiao’s chief adviser will not rule out a fight with Amir Khan in May despite promoter Bob Arum describing the prospect of a showdown with the British champion as “total and complete bulls***’’. 
Pacquiao was understood to have agreed to an April 23 fight with Queensland’s Jeff Horn, but that has been cast in doubt with reports in Britain linking Pacquiao to a big-money showdown with Khan. 
Arum dismissed the reports in an interview with the Courier-Mail , saying”the Amir Khan story has come out of nowhere”. 
But Mike Koncz, Pacquiao’s chief adviser, told Fox Sports News 500 discussions with multiple fighters were ongoing and would likely conclude next week. Manny Pacquiao and Jeff Horn. Source: Supplied 
“I’d prefer not to make any comments right now because there are a lot of undecided issues,” Koncz told Fox Sports News 500. 
“Hopefully by midweek next week we’ll have a final on everything. 
“All I’m going to do is fuel speculation in the media and I don’t want to do that. I don’t work that way. Once we have confirmed 100 per cent the venue and the arena and who the opponent is we’ll make an announcement. But until then I think it’s detrimental to all negotiations taking place and it’s not fair to the candidates we are looking to fight.” 
The apparent stand-off between Arum and Koncz over Pacquiao’s immediate boxing future has placed in jeopardy Horn’s much publicised fight with the Filipino champion. 
The Horn-Pacquiao showdown was originally scheduled for Suncorp Stadium on April 23, but Koncz has openly discussed moving the fight to the UAE. Manny Pacquiao lands a right to the head of Jessie Vargas during their WBO welterweight title fight. Source: AFP 
Pacquiao has remained largely silent on the issue, save for an interview with Fox Sports News 500 in January. 
“I cannot say if (Horn is) ready because I didn’t see his style or his face yet, so I don’t know,” Pacquiao said at the time. 
“He needs to prove it in the ring. Because in my previous fights many of them are saying they will stop me, they will knock me out and it’s not happening.” 
He added: “I’m hoping that the fight will be in Australia, I’d love to do that. I’ve been to Australia once or twice but for gambling.” View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
